column2: API Testing is a type of software testing that involves testing application programming interfaces (APIs) to ensure that they are functioning correctly and meeting their specified requirements. The following are the key responsibilities of an API Tester:     1.Design and execute test cases: The API Tester is responsible for designing and executing test cases to validate the functionality and performance of APIs.     2.Verify API results: The API Tester is responsible for verifying the results of API requests to ensure that they are accurate and meet the specified requirements.     3.The API Tester is responsible for debugging API issues and working with development teams to resolve them.     4.The API Tester is responsible for ensuring that APIs are secure and protecting sensitive information.Requirements Experience in software testing. Knowledge of API testing tools and techniques, as well as experience with programming languages such as Java, Python, or C++, is also essential for success in this role.

column2: Behind every great software developer is an equally great tester. Once a product reaches a certain point in its development the developers must hand it over to the tester to see if it works (or doesn't work).  Testing plays an important role in the development of new IT programmes and many every day products,  like cars and electronic goods.  So,  what will I actually be doing?  It's your job to work as hard as you can to 'break' the new product to help the design process. You'll work closely with software designers and programme managers to understand more about what each product is meant to do,  its key features and who will use it. Then you'll run functional tests,  customer scenario testing,  stress testing,  performance testing,  scalability testing and international testing. The ultimate goal is to iron out any bugs and improve the quality of the finished product.You'll often be working on more than one project at a time,  one product in first phase testing and another in its second or final phase. This means you'll work around the demands of the project rather than the clock.  OK,  I'm interested... But is it really the job for me?  Software experience and knowledge is a given to work as a software tester.Other skills that employers will look for include:   A good understanding of the software development process  A good understanding of the business approach  Good judgment skills  Good writing skills (for documenting the process)  Good communications and consultancy skills  The ability to work in a team and as an individual  Good presentation skills  The ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines  Expertise in Test Case Design,  Test Execution and Defect Management.  Should have minimum 2 years of experience Automation QA using selenium with framework design.   Manual And Automation QA - Selenium /   MSTest Suite.
column11: Framework design, Stress testing, Automation, Performance testing, Manual, Software Quality Analyst, Selenium, Defect management, Business Executive, Testing

column2: An Integration Analyst is a key member of the T-System Engineering team that provides outstanding service and solutions to clients through the interface and integration data gathering phase, interface configuration, testing, deployment and go live as well as software upgrades as it pertains to the interfaces.      PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:      Responsible for assisting clients with the data gathering process, integration issues pertaining to the contracted interfaces, configuration, developing and testing.      Provide support to the various departments and teams involved in the interface deployment, such as Project Management, Training, and Technical Support. Other departments may include Product Management, Development and QA.      Build configure the interfaces and route through the Integration engine      Facilitate resolution of Interface issues on T-System software and issues associated with the electronic demographics, orders, results, reports, Vitals and Problem lists to the ancillary departments and the HIS. Document and share Interface configuration and the integration model with the Technical Support team and assist in the training process as it pertains to each client. Adhere to and lead in the development or improvement of department procedures.      Maintain an excellent customer satisfaction standard.      Align conduct with the Company s Code of Ethics and Business Conduct and support the Company s Ethics and Compliance Program      Actively participate in Company provided training and education      Ensure individual compliance with all privacy and security rules and regulations and commit to the protection of all Company confidential information, including but not limited to, Personal Health Information      MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:      College Degree or an equivalent combination of education and directly related experience required      3-6 years of Integration experience with Ancillary systems such as Lab, Radiology, Respiratory Therapy, Pharmacy Medication Supply Stations and Vital Sign Monitors      Experience managing high priority work flow issues and their associated communications      Experience with XSLT, XML, Visual Basic, or other scripting\/programming knowledge required      Experience with Integration engines Corepoint or Mirth required      Experience with FHIR is a plus      Knowledge of HL7 standards and experience implementing HL7 interfaces required      SQL Query experience for data export\/import is required      Proactive (ie predict problems\/problem areas); identify and coordinate quality solutions to issues      Demonstrate attention to detail, ability to work independently or in a team environment      High level of organization and strong telephone and interpersonal contact skills required      Very Strong customer service and communication skills      Able to provide support, promote professionalism and work well with people in all areas and at all levels of the company      Able to work with minimal supervision to carry out departmental goals      Able to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical personnel

column2: We are seeking a talented QA Automation Engineer to design testing procedures for our software applications.     In this role, you will be responsible for analysing the functionality of applications and designing automated tests to validate their performance.     You will also be required to identify bugs, install databases, and collaborate with the software design team. They should have advanced programming skills, a keen eye for detail, and excellent project management skills.     The key function automation QA Engineers is writing scripts and creating automation environments for repeated tests.     Using different automation tools, they design, test, and deploy effective test automation solutions.      Their goal is to automate as much of the testing effort as possible with a minimum set of code. This way you would optimize the testing that otherwise would consume a large percentage of test resources.      Thus A skilled QA Automation Engineer should design and write efficient test procedures for every software application.         Responsibilities         Meeting with the software design team to discuss verification protocols.     Identifying software application weaknesses and target areas.     Sketching out ideas for automated software test procedures.     maximize test coverage for the most critical features of the system     Reviewing software bug reports and highlighting problem areas.Write, design, and execute automated tests by creating scripts that run testing functions automatically     determine the priority for test scenarios and create execution plans to implement these scenarios     Write documentation for automated processes including test plans, test procedures, and test cases     build test automation frameworks     log and document bugs in the tracking system     set up Continuous Integration.     Writing automation scripts and implementing software applications     Designing and installing software databases.     Troubleshooting automation software and finalizing system procedures.     Identifying quality issues and creating test reports.     Collaborating with the design team to solve application faults.         Requirements         Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar field.     Previous experience working as a QA Automation Engineer.     Advanced programming skills including automation systems and databases.     Familiarity with programming script languages including Java and VBScript.     Excellent analytical skills.     Detailed knowledge of application functions, bug fixing, and testing protocols.     Good written and verbal communication skills.     Strong attention to detail.     Good project management skills.
column11: Computer science, continuous integration, Software design, VB SCRIPT, Script writing, Project management, Test scenarios, Test cases, Troubleshooting, Application software

column2: Senior Performance Tester - Permanent Opportunity Hyderabad-Need immediate joiners only (            Be part of a dedicated technical testing division, at the forefront of a global top 4 growing testing company with unrivalled progression prospects  Looking for career progression with a global top 4 in Technical Testing Services  Competitive Salary, Company Benefits, Overtime, Training & Certification  Global opportunities available for staff who show outstanding performance and deliver high quality work    This role requires you to apply your specialised technical knowledge to deliver client-centric solutions & your people management skills to inspire & lead the best technical talent.  Applicants will be required to complete a 1-2 hour technical assessment to demonstrate their performance testing capability so if you are confident in your programming, scripting and coding ability, please apply!***            About Us    Planit is the leading specialist technical testing, software testing and training organisation in Asia Pacific and top 4 globally with over 1,000 permanent employees across Australia, New Zealand, India and UK, and we are currently experiencing a period of rapid growth. Due to this rapid expansion we are seeking a highly experienced Test Analysts within Performance to join our Hyderabad team on a permanent basis. You will be working with the best in the industry and enjoying a variety of employee incentives including award-winning career development programmes.  We are seeking enthusiastic Engineer L1 (Senior Performance Tester) for our Hyderabad location. You will be given the tools you need to advance your skills and experience, while developing a rewarding career and adding true value to your career and clients.          Skills and Responsibilities:  Strong understanding of performance testing methodologies best practices.  Participate in performance test requirements and create the performance test plan.  Identify possible bottlenecks of performance, closely monitor performance execution.   Strong experience in performance test script creation, execution and troubleshooting via JMeter and Load Runner.  Individual contributor to manage small scale performance testing projects.  Good Communication skills to interact and work directly with the clients.              Culture          Work with like-minded colleagues who have a passion for Technical Testing excellence. Within an encouraging and supportive environment, the team-orientated culture is helpful, friendly, inclusive and flexible. The Senior Management team has a shared vision and with an open and approachable style, employees have the freedom to bring ideas forward and feel empowered to learn.              Benefits    As a permanent employee of Planit, you will be entitled to all the benefits made available to our staff. Planit offers all employees a highly competitive remuneration package, a wide range of employee benefits, and exceptional career development opportunities with unrivalled training and certification opportunities.    This is a great opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing organisation where your vision and expertise can shape the growth of our business.    Apply now to take the next step in your technical testing career!      www.planittesting.com      Planit is an equal opportunity employer.        If interested, please share your updated Resume to sowjanyach@planittesting.com.

column2: Role Description The Test Automation Engineer works with various scrum teams and infrastructure teams - both internal & strategic vendors, to define Test Automation Strategy and roadmap, develop high quality technology solutions to maximise standardisation and reuse, in order to ensure that testing reduces in cost while maintaining Deutsche Bank's high quality standards They will take lead in topics of test automation, data validation and service virtualisation. They need to have specialisation in one or more of tools such as Selenium WebDriver, Protractor, Cypress, GreenHat Tester Rational Integration Tester, SOAP UI NG PRO, HP Service Virtualization manager, Tosca, Worksoft Certify Alternatively they should have specialisation in one of the Mobile Testing tools such HP Mobile Center, Perfecto Mobile or similar open source solutions. They must have hands-on expertise and skills in at least one modern objected orientated language e.g. Java, .NET (C#), Python, Groovy, JavaScript, etc. Your key responsibilities Provide inputs to definition of Enterprise Test Automation Strategy and roadmap Takes ownership of strategy and solution design, development and implementation in specific system areas, such as, Cloud, Continuous Delivery and Test Behaviour Driven Development Design, Develop and Implement test automation frameworks and reusable components for various platforms and technologies Design, Develop and Implement Service Virtualization solutions for Server and Mobile applications Provide technical guidance to a team of Test Automation Analysts to ensure high quality automation deliverables Be hands-on with ability to lead a team, track & monitor automation KPIs and develop automation scripts People Management Takes ownership for own career management, seeking opportunities for continuous development of personal capability and improved performance contribution Your skills and experience Note: Number of years indicated are a minimum level of experience. Area Years Proven hands-on experience in Architecting Automation & System solutions5 years Strong technology knowledge and expertise in the field of Systems Automation6 years Specialisation in industry standard Automation (CI, Release & Test) and Service Virtualisation tools 3 years in one tool; 1 year in 2 others Experience in defining & implementing tool strategy, test automation frameworks and reusable components across multiple platforms or technologies such as End-User (UI - desktop browser mobile) and Servers (middleware back-end)3 years Programming expertise in modern object oriented languages such as .NET (C#), Python, Groovy, JavaScript 4 years Good communication skills and demonstrated ability to interface clients 3 years Proven experience of defining and implementing Technology Strategies3 years Overall relevant IT experience & demonstrated ability to Lead Technical teams8-10 years

column2: Job Overview     We are looking for a QA Automation Engineer to join our team of IT professionals. In this role, you will be suggesting ideas for automated software test procedures. Besides, you will be highlighting problem areas and tracking bugs that hinder software installation.     You will also be designing and installing software databases. As a QA Automation Engineer, you will be liaising with the Developers and Project Managers to identify and test key features of software programs. Apart from testing, you should be able to develop wellplanned and structured test plans/cases.     You will be investigating the causes of nonconforming software programs. You should be detail-oriented and possess excellent troubleshooting abilities. If you have a strong technical background and can streamline all testing activities, then we would love to have you on board.         Responsibilities        Planning and prioritizing testing activities         Coordinating with the Design team to discuss verification protocols         Helping identify weaknesses and problem areas in the software application         Suggesting automated software test procedures         Tracking software bugs and investigating the causes         Pointing out problem areas         Preparing automation scripts         Communicating with the QA Engineer to implement software applications         Designing and handling the installation of software databases         Troubleshooting automation software issues         Coordinating with the System Analyst to finalize system procedures         Creating test plans and cases         Preparing detailed test reports          Prioritizing and executing tests         Reviewing technical specifications and design documents          Conducting regression testing when needed         Monitoring assurance metrics and process results           Requirements        Bachelor s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or related         Previous work experience as a QA Engineer, QA Tester, or relevant position in the IT department         Complete understanding of automation systems and databases         Knowledge of programming languages like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS         Basic knowledge of scripting and other related procedures         Expertise in automation testing tools like Selenium, Katalon Studio, and Cucumber         Understanding of testing protocols         Know-how of different types of testing methods like white box and black box testing         Familiarity with the software development process         Good analytical and troubleshooting skills         Attention to detail         Strong communication skills         Ability to work collaboratively         Ability to manage project deadlines          Good time management and organizational skills

column2: Role Purpose:      The role of a Senior QA (Automation) Engineer involves defining and driving innovative automated testing strategies and toolsets into the overall development process, performing Quality Assurance and Test activities, analyzing the results and submitting observations to the development team. This involves developing and executing tests across the Platform to ensure application performance, scalability, functional consistency and security.    The ideal candidate would be an effective communicator who is comfortable discussing issues / ideas within the business and with clients. The right candidate would also be an enthusiastic tester whose drive is towards continuous improvement and a focus on helping the team deliver quality product.     Key Accountabilities:        Create test designs, test processes, test cases and test data.         Ensure scalability: Test the architecture effectively to ensure scalability without compromising on performance by using smart test data samples to test the framework of the application at important moments.         Ascertain functional consistency: Define variability accurately through effective functional testing to remove uncertainty.         Security Testing: Proper testing needs to be done to ensure that confidential data, processed on a big data platform, should be kept secure. Security of large volumes of data used should be ensured while developing the application.         Failover Testing: Validate recovery method and check that data processing happens seamlessly when switched from name node to other data nodes.         Automation Testing: Automated regression test suite should be executed after release to speed up the test coverage and save time during Big Data validations.         Become involved in the creation of business requirements, inputting test scripts and test scenarios to ensure developers understand the business requirements, ensuring effective testing.         Design and write test automation scripts using test automation frameworks.         Execute all test cases and report defects, define severity and priority for each defect.         Ensure that all test related work is carried out as per the defined standards and procedures.         Capture, record and document bugs allowing Development teams to readily reproduce issues.         Participate in walkthroughs of testing procedures.         Prepare reports related to software testing carried out.         Interact with clients to better understand product requirements or design modifications.         Contribute toward predictable delivery of quality releases.         Be meticulous about documentation and maintaining a robust log of all test cases and test results.         Proactively bring issues/problems to the attention of the team; generating, proposing and implementing innovative solutions to solve them.         Work as part of cross functional, passionate agile project teams to ensure quality is driven into the heart of the development process from requirements definition through to delivery.       Experience:       3+ years of demonstrable QA and Test experience across full SDLC, working in tooling or QA Automation.         Ability to interpret written requirements and technical specifications and derive valuable test cases.         Building test infrastructures using containerization technologies such as Docker and working within continuous delivery / continuous release pipeline processes.         Testing enterprise applications deployed to cloud environments such as AWS.         Understanding of coding enterprise applications within Java, Scala, Python and other languages.         Understanding of Hadoop and NoSQL database technologies, MySQL and Elastic Seacrh.         Agile / Scrum experience.         Understanding of development methodologies.         Experience using GIT.       Skills:          Strong Analytical, Development and Testing skills, including a thorough understanding of how to translate requirements into design specs, coding and creating test scenarios for functional and end-to-end testing.         Paying attention to detail to look for patterns and spot irregularities.         Learning new skills willingly in the ever-changing world of technology.         Understanding the lifecycle of a project from conception through to result.         Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.         Ability to collaborate positively with team members based locally and remotely.         Excellent client facing skills.       Knowledge:         Thorough understanding of SDLC, specifically automated QA processes in agile development environments.         Significant experience in Test automation and Dev Ops tooling         Practical knowledge of Big Data technologies Spark and Hadoop         Technology know-how on the relevant technology stack used.         Proficient with bug tracking and test management toolsets to support development processes.       Education:          B.Tech / Equivalent degree in Computer Science.         CTFL, ISTQB, CSQA or CSTE certified Degree level qualifications in a technical related subject is preferred.

column2: We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality. QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions.      You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.) The QA technician role plays an important part in our company s product development process.      Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we d like to meet you. Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.     Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback     Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and automation test scripts     Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities     Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools     Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs     Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved     Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs     Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements     Monitor debugging process results     Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts     Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

column2: An Automation Test Engineer is responsible for designing and implementing automated tests to ensure that software systems are functioning correctly.          The main responsibilities of this role include:         Test planning and design: The Automation Test Engineer must be able to plan and design automated tests that effectively cover all relevant aspects of the software. This involves creating test cases, test scripts, and other test artifacts.     Automated test development: The Automation Test Engineer must be able to develop automated tests using a variety of tools and technologies. This includes writing code, configuring test frameworks, and integrating automated tests into continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.     Test execution and maintenance: The Automation Test Engineer must be able to execute automated tests, interpret test results, and maintain automated tests over time.      This involves fixing failed tests, updating tests to reflect changes in the software, and ensuring that automated tests continue to provide value.     The ideal candidate for this role will have a strong technical background, with experience in software development and testing.     They should have excellent problem-solving skills, the ability to work independently.
column11: Automation testing, Selenium, Client interfacing

column1: Automation Tester- Member of technical Staff
column2: We are looking for a  Member of Technical Staff( Automation Tester )  to join our Clinicals test automation team within our Bangalore R&D division. Your job will be to build UI and API tests for the products and services offered for Clinicals. Help us reach our goal of becoming the healthcare backbone by enhancing our cloud based EHR solution and leveraging the network effect of 85,400+ providers. Apply your technical skills towards delivering a quality product to customers and allowing doctors to be doctors so that they can spend more time doing what they do best: provide patient care. You are Technologists with zeal to solve complex problems, growth mindset, fast learners who are willing to work in fast paced environment with total accountability. Our athenaClinicals automation team builds UI and API tests which enable build confidence on quality and enables doctors workflows that is used by over 100,000 healthcare providers daily. We build quality practices which interface that makes the interactions between these providers and the electronic health record as seamless as possible, and elevates what the doctor needs to see, when they need to see it. This team is innovative, passionate, and driven by our mission to help make an impact. Job Responsibilities Understand business workflow and translate it into effective E2E test scenarios to ensure comprehensive coverage of business functionality. Analyze business critical workflows which are candidates for UI automation thereby identifying critical areas for testing. Provide feedback and suggestions for improving the business workflow based on testing observations. Strong ability to collaborate with development teams and stakeholders to brainstorm and implement innovative solutions to handle automation challenges. Strong collaboration and communication skills to work closely with cross-functional teams. Strong understanding and practical experience with Agile methodologies like Scrum Proactive approach to identifying potential problems and implementing preventive measures. Demonstrated ability to adapt and learn new technologies quickly. Adhere to test automation coding practices and ensure zero review comments. Resolve automation challenges for not automatable controls independently by considering best design options for scalability and reliability. Ensure automated tests are passing 100 % when integrated with existing automated test suite. Ensure failures are resolved with least turnaround time to ensure 100 % pass. Articulate automation challenges and communicate to stake holders. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage workload effectively within Agile frameworks. Experience in conducting daily stand-up meetings, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Estimate size of development tasks and provide appropriate story points. Typical Qualifications 3-5 years of automation testing experience with significant product development expertise Proficient in Typescript and Javascript. Strong expertise in UI Automation using Selenium Webdriver. Familiarity with API Automation using POSTMAN. Knowledge of BDD (Behavior-Driven Development). Understanding Page Object Model. Familiarity with SQL or Oracle queries. Basic understanding of C#, Java or any programming language. Experienced in debugging code. Ability to analyze test automation failures and resolve automation failures with quick turn around time. Familiarity with source code management tools like GitHub or Bitbucket. Bachelors degree or equivalent.
column11: Selenium Webdriver, Selenium, Javascript, Postman

column2: Job Description    We are looking to hire a skilled Software Quality Assurance Engineer to ensure software or product quality in both functional and the UI perspectives for our company. You will be responsible for designing test cases by understanding requirements in depth, execution of prepared test cases, bug reporting and management. To ensure success as a Software Tester, you should have in-depth knowledge of Software Testing Fundamentals, how to execute testing methodologies in efficient way and strong documentation skills.       Responsibilities       1. Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases.   2. Translate functional requirements and specifications into documented test plans, cases and steps.   3. Identifying issues, risks and dependencies escalating and managing where appropriate.   4. Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle.   5. Promote and advocate best practices within the team and throughout the business.   6. Work closely with product managers, designers, and developers to ensure a successful, high quality user experience   7. Review user stories with business analysts, designers and developers to ensure tests are appropriate to demonstrate that delivered solution meets agreed requirements   8. Researches new products and industry methodologies and facilitates the development of new concepts, techniques, and standards.       Technical Skills       1. Detailed understanding of Software Testing Lifecycle   2. Good knowledge on Test Case preparation, review execution   3. Defects reporting, review and management   4. Demonstrable experience in SDLC methodology such as waterfall, SCRUM, or agile methodologies   5. Hands-on experience in Testing Web/Mobile/iPad applications   6. Good analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail   7. Ability to work independently, or in cross functional team   8. Have ability to organize and prioritize workload in order to meet necessary deadlines.   9. Able to work with geographically dispersed teams   10. You re familiar with Jira or other process management tools that help make our jobs easier and more productive   11. Good to have automation skills to reduce work efforts   12. Continually update skills by learning new technologies relevant to the role   13. You believe in delivering back to community and you do contributions toward it       Soft Skills       1. Strong communication skills   2. Requirement Gathering   3. Preparing estimate   4. Agility and quick learner   5. Good Analytical and problem-solving skills   6. Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities   7. Should have a high level of energy working as an individual contributor and as a part of team   8. Good command over verbal and written English communication   9. Ability to think out of the box and questioning everything

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for TCS-Automation Testing to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing automated testing solutions to ensure the quality and reliability of our software products. If you have a strong background in automation testing, proficiency in testing tools, and a passion for delivering high-quality software, we invite you to apply for this position.     Responsibilities : Test Automation Framework : Design and develop test automation frameworks tailored to the project requirements.Implement efficient and maintainable automation scripts for regression and functional testing.     Scripting and Coding : Write and maintain automated test scripts using programming languages such as Java, Python, or other relevant languages.Collaborate with the development team to integrate testing into the continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline.Test Planning : Contribute to test planning activities, including defining test scenarios, test cases, and acceptance criteria.Work closely with the testing team to understand project requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.     Execution and Analysis : Execute automated test suites and analyze results to identify defects and areas for improvement.Investigate and report issues, providing detailed information to developers for resolution.Integration Testing : Implement and execute automated integration tests to ensure seamless collaboration between software components.Verify data consistency and interoperability in complex systems.Performance Testing : Collaborate with performance testing teams to integrate automated performance testing into the overall testing strategy.Analyze performance test results and provide insights for optimization.
column11: automation framework, Automation testing, Test scripts, Testing tools, Coding, Functional testing, Integration testing, Test scenarios, Test cases, Python

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for Automation/Manual Testing Professional to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Automation Testing:Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for web applications, APIs, or mobile applications using appropriate automation tools and frameworks (e g, Selenium, Appium, RestAssured)     Create and maintain a scalable and modular automation framework to ensure code reusability and maintainability     Manual Testing:Develop and execute manual test cases to ensure the quality and functionality of software applications     Perform exploratory testing to identify defects and ensure a comprehensive testing approach     Test Planning and Strategy:Collaborate with QA and development teams to create comprehensive test plans and strategies     Identify suitable test scenarios for automation and execute them manually when necessary     Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to support continuous testing and delivery practices     Participate in the continuous improvement of CI/CD processes related to testing     Cross-Browser and Cross-Platform Testing:Perform cross-browser and cross-platform testing to ensure consistent functionality and user experience across various environments     Defect Management:Identify, document, and track defects in both automated and manual testing processes     Work closely with development teams to facilitate timely resolutions     Performance Testing:Collaborate with performance testing teams to design and execute performance tests to assess system scalability and responsiveness     Collaboration and Communication:Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and other QA team members     Communicate effectively on testing progress, issues, and results     Documentation:Maintain detailed documentation for automated test scripts, manual test cases, test plans, and testing processes     Create and update documentation for the automation framework     Training and Support:Provide training and support to team members on testing methodologies, tools, and best practices     Reporting and Analysis:Generate comprehensive reports on test execution results, defect status, and overall testing progress     Analyze test results to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement

column2: Role Description Our Investments agile teams at Deutsche Bank - Private Bank (TDI) develop and maintain applications for securities business of Private Customers. Changes are generally announced on short notice due to regulatory requirements or time to market challenges. Quality and stability has priority together with time to market. By working in an Agile DevOps model, acting a pilot for Investments and actively improving the model, we achieve very high quality while continuously delivering value to our clients. Located in Germany and India, we work closely together using agile and virtual collaboration techniques and our teams diversity to reach our goals of continuous deployment, process improvement and internalizing engineering know how. As a Quality and Testing Engineer you will closely work together with business and operation units and bring functional testing, test management and test automation skills to enforce the development team within a Squad. You will extensively make use and apply test automation concepts and practices in the context of Deutsche Banks digitalization journey. Your key responsibilities You are involved in the Software Development Lifecycle starting from analyzing requirements, maintaining test cases, developing test automation features and testing software - continuously improving these topics. Your primary focus will be on creating test cases, developing test automation features and execute test activities on different test environments You develop high-quality and mostly automated test solutions that meet functional as well as non-functional requirements. column2: As a Software test Lead, you will be responsible for leading and handling the verification and validation activities throughout the software development lifecycle. Your role will involve ensuring the quality, reliability, and compliance of software products through effective testing and validation processes. What will you do? Develop and implement a comprehensive test strategy aligned with project goals and industry standards. Collaborate with project managers, architects, and stakeholders to define testing objectives and timelines. Develop test automation suites using UFT framework. Own the creation of detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts based on project requirements and specifications. Ensure adequate test coverage to mitigate risks associated with software changes. Supervise and lead a team of verification and validation test engineers. Provide mentorship, guidance, and performance feedback to team members. Be responsible for the execution of testing activities, including functional testing, integration testing, system testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT). Evaluate, implement, and coordinate the use of automated testing tools to improve testing efficiency and coverage. Drive the adoption of standard processes for test automation within the team. Establish and implement processes for defect tracking, reporting, and resolution. Find opportunities for process improvement and optimization. Minimum Requirements or Qualifications: Bachelors / masters in computer science. 8+ years of testing experience for medical device products. Strong hands-on experience in automation using UFT. Experience in testing IVD products. Validated experience in software verification and validation of medical device or IVD software products according to ISO 13485, with a focus on leading testing efforts. Strong understanding of testing methodologies and industry standards. Experience with automated testing tools and frameworks. Familiarity with regulatory requirements for software development (e.g., FDA, ISO standards).

column2: PASSION    EXCELLENCE   What You'll be part   of at symphony fintech   We're are financial technology company with focus on capital market on a mission to reinvent the trading business is done through innovation and automation technology. We believe that our people are not only our greatest asset but also our biggest competitive advantage. Innovation and our exceptional team are at the heart of what makes Symphony Fintech. We are constantly on a look out for talented,  high- performing,  and enthusiastic people to join our team   Let's shape together the world for the better.   Our team members are smart,  collaborative and have fun working with each other. Our leadership shares an exciting,  evolving vision for the company and empowers employees to help shape and deliver that vision.   "Symphony Fintech is a great place to grow personally and professionally. The people here are very helpful. Symphony Fintech follows an open door policy which encourages effective communication and healthy discussions. Within the organization,  I have always witnessed a collaborative culture and a management which is focused on growth of its people and the organization. Right since the day I joined the organization I have felt comfortable at all levels and motivated to give my best."   Project Manager   You thrive on the energy and entrepreneurship of a start- up environment especially in a really cool team that has already achieved impressive success you'll love it here. We provide a collaborative day- to- day environment where everyone's voice can be heard.    Roles and Responsibilities    -  Working as part of one of high performing software teams,  you'll be developing the UX/ UI of a low latency Multi- asset trading platform using C# WPF,  Windows Form    -  The systems have high update rates and require very powerful and optimized UIs and servers to cope with these demands. column2: Great is not good enough for our QA Engineers. Help us to deliver even better quality in our products.               You will work in one of our Scrum-oriented development teams dedicated to different components of our successful digital banking platform. You will be responsible to drive the testing processes in your team based on the RD Test Strategy and the decisions taken by the QA Guild.                 The team and you help the development team to develop software with a focus on a quality deliverable and work closely with the product owner and developers in refinement, estimation, planning, standups and retrospectives. Together with your team, you create CI/CD jobs and pipelines according to the SDLC process.                  Your passion for quality extends beyond scripting simple manual or automated tests. You have an eye for detail and can articulate your approach to non-technical stakeholders.                 You understand the value of collaboration and soliciting opinions and approaches that may differ from yours and are ready to pick up and enhance existing automated and manual tests that cover functional and nonfunctional (e.g. performance, load, security) requirements.                 On top of that, you will be developing and executing manual and automated tests that cover functional and nonfunctional requirements in challenging and constantly changing environment.                 At Backbase we work agile and you know what this means for the QA role. Finally, you will contribute ideas for process improvement to your team and the wider Backbase community.         How about you           You are an experienced QA Engineer with strong hands on test automation experience (backend, frontend, end to end).              You have good development skills in Java and/or JavaScript and profound knowledge of REST, SOAP, API and automated testing tools (e.g. Protractor and Rest assured).              You have experience with continuous integration tools like Jenkins and/or GoCD.              You hold a Bachelor degree in computer science or similar.

column2: Role Description  As a Quality and Testing Engineer you will closely work together with business and operation units and bring functional testing, test management and test automation skills to enforce the development team within a Squad.  You will extensively make use and apply test automation concepts and practices in the context of Deutsche Banks digitalization journey. Key Roles & Responsibilities You are involved in the Software Development Lifecycle starting from analyzing requirements, maintaining test cases, developing test automation features and testing software - continuously improving these topics. Develop/ support test automation strategy for large complex projects in AGILE methodology. Develop support non-functional testing automation strategy for large complex projects in AGILE methodology. Contribute to team agile planning activities and backlog prioritization and management. Collaborates with product line stakeholders to understand and develop strategies, frameworks relating to their emerging demands. Driving innovation/adoption of Industry practices through investigation / institutionalization of new tools/methods/standards. Ensures that testing activities are being conducted in accordance with the testing strategy and plan. Perform and achieve in sprint testing team and release goals. Create test documents like: Test Plan, Test Risk Assessments, and Test Results and make sure that they are reviewed and approved by appropriate stakeholders. Participate in estimation of User Stories in Story points. Create, Automate and Execute test cases to cover all user stories acceptance criteria and honor timely deliveries. Increase the test coverage and test speed by automating all possible test cases. Create and develop test automation frameworks. Integrate test automation framework into CI/CD pipeline. Ensure test flakiness is at a minimum. Participate and help in knowledge transfer sessions when necessary. Defects submission, monitoring, and retesting Keep demo sessions to prove acceptance criteria are met. Coordinate the preparation of test environments. Define and create all test data test data generators needed for the tests. Maintain regression test pack. Align with dev team to understand the integration with different systems to execute System Integration Testing Provide regular status reporting to scrum team. Verify entry/exit criteria for all SIT, UAT phases. You actively participate and contribute into the sprint activities and ceremonies e.g. daily stand-up, Sprint planning, retrospectives, refinements etc. You collaborate with other team members to achieve the sprint objectives Your Skills and Experience: Strong experience in  requirements analysis for test case creation and test execution of user stories  using tools like Quality Centre/ALM, Confluence , Jira ,SOAP UI, Filetransfer, SQL developer, Strong experience in  development of Test Automation features using  UFT  (unified functional testing)  and / or Selenium  with Java Experience in  API testing  is a must. Experience in Postman is an additional benefit. Open for manual testing for at least a year in parallel to identifying automation candidates. Individual contributor with an attitude to learn and deliver. Pro-active team player  with  good communication  skills as well as good  English  language skills. Experience with  Agile/SCRUM  environment including agile tooling and methodology together with Knowledge of investment business and its operations.

column2: Please share resume on hamid.batliwala@sscinc.com Opportunity snapshot: A full time Senior Performance Test role is required due to the rapid growth in performance & volume  testing (PVT) demands of the Bluedoor Wealth Management product, which is undergoing a transition from  a legacy .Net-based system to microservice-based deployment on AWS using Kubernetes. This role is  crucial in ensuring the product continues to meet performance, scalability and reliability goals while  operating under a hybrid legacy + microservices model in this transition period. Direct reports: Not applicable. Role & Responsibilities: ??Self-Managed full performance test life cycle: define test requirements and scope,  planning/schedule, test scenario and build, execution, monitor, analysis and reporting of accurate  results and status to target audiences within timeframes. Collaboration with delivery teams to  resolve performance defects.  ??Delivery of all test artefacts including Test Plan, Progress Reports, and Test Summary Reports to  certify Releases to Production. ??Active participation in performance risk identification (business and technical impact) and  mitigation actions, establishment of performance NFRs and benchmarks. ??Develop a deep understanding of our products, services, and technology to effectively communicate  and bridge the performance gap between business and technical teams. ??Drive and define performance testing strategy, process, and tools for efficient and effective  Program delivery, and to align with industry standards. ??Continue to deliver and enhance the performance testing of the legacy Bluedoor Platform for major  releases and other crucial business events. ??Ownership of test environment and capacity planning. ??Ability to work collaboratively in a cross functional, multi-region team located in AU, India, and UK.  Flexibility to attend meetings/workshop at reasonable overlapped hours. ??Automation of test artefacts to reduce cost and effort.  Technical Skills & Qualifications. ??5 + years in a performance test engineering role which includes working with microservices and  cloud-based technology.  ??Preferred experience within superannuation, wealth management or other financial services  domain. ??Mastery of Performance Test Tools: o Knowledge of scripting languages and the ability to write code for test automation.  Mandatory: HTTP Protocol - Microfocus LoadRunner - C coding + manual correlation  Microservices: K6, JMeter, Gatling, etc.  Database languages: MS SQL, Postgres o Monitoring and Analysis:  Mandatory: LoadRunner Analysis  On-Prem: Microsoft Perfmon.   Cloud: Prometheus, Grafana, and AWS CloudWatch. ??Strong understanding and/or hands-on technology experience with the following: o On-Premise: Windows Server, SQL Server (2012+), .Net o Cloud-based:  AWS Web Services, including EC2, Lambda, RDS, S3, and other relevant services, and  how to optimize applications for AWS infrastructure.  Microservices: Strong understanding of microservices architecture, principles, and  best practices.  Kubernetes: Container orchestration and management, including deployment  strategies, scaling, and resource management. ??Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and how  to integrate performance testing into the CI/CD process. Experience in this area highly regarded. ??Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Teams, Office suite. ??Proficiency with Confluence and JIRA ??Proficiency with source/version control tools, e.g. Bitbucket/GIT ??Experience working in Agile or Scrum development environments where rapid iterations and  continuous improvement are practiced. ??Candidate must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident. ??Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline.  ??Desirable: Microsoft or AWS certifications. Key attributes: ??Strong analytical, statistical, and presentational skills and critical thinking to identify and solve  complex problems. ??Understanding task objectives and expected outcomes.  ??Exceptional attention to detail. ??Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with both technical and non-technical  audiences at all organizational levels. ??Clear, concise, consistent written and verbal communication, demonstrating understanding of  target audiences and stakeholders. ??Making informed decisions using sources of data and quantitative information, and where little is available, use other methods/strategies: qualitative information, benchmarking, educated  assumptions, industry standards. ??Maintain awareness of external activities/schedules, factors, events, etc. that may influence or  impact deliverables. Manage impact and stakeholder expectations on deliverables.  ??Take performance managers direction on priority call when required.

column2: The following are the guidelines and requirements for the Automation framework:      ?     1. Adhere to CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) for Automation framework.    2. Use an easy-to-understand framework, preferably BDD (Behaviour-Driven Development) implemented in a Given, When, Then format. This format helps both technical and non-technical users to    understand the test scenarios in plain language.    3. Provide comprehensive reporting and overview of what was tested, including the number of tests executed as part of a release, covering regression and smoke testing scenarios. All issues raised during    testing must be reported in Jira.    4. Maintain a common repository for all test cases in Jira, accessible , including both manual and automated tests.    5. Implement a regression suite maintenance process that includes handling production defects to prevent the recurrence of bugs in production.    (Atlassian) Jira / Confluence Confluence is used for all our KT and documentation, including post-mortems, operational processes and procures, the release.change calendar and technicalarchitecture.    6. Do not maintain separate smoke and regression suites but use test case tagging to run only smoke or only regression tests, or both.    7. Implement unit testing during the development cycle, and share the details.    8. Optimise the handling of the Automation backlog, which includes tests and bugs.    9. Efficiently manage defects through effective Root Cause Analysis (RCA) sessions and take actions to avoid their recurrence.    10. Provide brand-wise reporting for regression testing to allow better insights into the testing coverage.    11. Focus on introducing API testing to reduce the reliance on UI testing for functionality checks.    12. Daily maintenance of the regression suite to address failing and flaky test cases.    13. Implement Requirement Traceability to map requirements to test cases.    14. Have dedicated Test environments with Production data, configuration, and content synchronised with the production environment.    15. Update the regression suite based on the progression of test cases as new functionalities are added or existing ones are modified.    16. Clear and designated Single Points of Contact (SPOCs) for specific queries within the AMS team is essential for effective communication and issue resolution, covering: deployment-related queries, there should be one designated SPOC who will handle all questions and concerns related to deployments and for environment-related queries, another SPOC should be assigned to address any issues or inquiries concerning environments.          *By following these guidelines, the Automation framework will be robust, efficient, and align with testing standards and practices.      *Having these designated SPOCs documented under the Confluence page will provide visibility to everyone involved in the project/support process. This documentation will serve as a quick reference for      team members, enabling them to know exactly who to reach out to for specific types of questions or problems.      *Having clear communication channels and SPOCs will streamline the support process and enhance collaboration within the AMS team. It also ensures that important information and knowledge are      shared effectively, leading to better incident management and issue resolution.      QA process:        QA should be involved in all the meetings - refinement , sprint planning, RCA meetings, retrospectives      Test management tool to be used for Sprint Test execution(Jira, zephyr).      Requirement traceability matrix to map requirements to the test cases.      Test cases to be drafted before the sprint start and get reviewed by QA team.      Final QA sign off should be from QA team.      Test cases should be with detailed test steps, actual result and expected result.      Clear visibility for what is been tested with evidences(Screenshots, video recordings) and related bugs if any to be linked to the JIRA ticket(story/epic)      RCA process for every production bug, process to not see it again by adding it to automation regression suite.      Defect management      Defect backlog to be maintained and reduced with every sprint incoming.        Every defect should have below details    - Steps to reproduce    - Evidence(screenshots, logs)    Environment details    Test data    Expected and actual results    Requirement reference for every defect

Our QAEs are not pure black box testers,  they are able to understand software internals,  debug problems using log files,  and write automated tests with Scripting tools and/ or user- level automated tools. QAEs at Amazon are excellent individual contributors capable of taking up tasks from start to completion with minimal help. QAEs would be responsible for understanding the domain and the product in detail and coming up with the test strategy/ planning,  coming up with the test cases,  driving the test case sign- off processes with the stakeholders,  contributing to code level Unit tests,  test execution and reporting. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS    BE in Computer Science or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience of minimum 5 years  Expertise in test methodologies and test processes.  Ability to understand technical specifications and generate test cases from them  Good in communicating with developers and technical leaders,  even if they are remote.  Strong organizational skills,  ability to track multiple test executions simultaneously and synthesize the results  Shows creativity and initiative to improve product coverage and effectiveness.  Should be able to generate test reports and dashboards for management communication.  Experience in designing the automation framework for Web/  Devices.    PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS    Experience in Java,  Selenium,  or Any other equivalent Web UI automation.  Understanding of Performance and Load testing.  Experience in testing in multiple platforms like Web,  Devices & other music devices.

You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.)        The QA engineer role plays an important part in our company s product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we d like to meet you.        Ultimately, candidates should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards. column2: It s fun to work for a company where people are passionate and believe in what they re doing. We at Medocity are working on making the world a healthier place.   Medocity is looking for a talented and enthusiastic UI / UX Lead who can map out the big picture of design across web and mobile platforms. The UX Lead will be expected to work collaboratively with senior management ,  as well as the product teams to create detailed user friendly products and websites for a great user experience. This is a significant opportunity to join a fast growing company as well as take on a leadership role within a growing product organization.   3+ years of experience developing  /  testing enterprise applications. Experience of hands - on testing in Agile development environments (especially Scrum). Experience with black box manual testing ,  UI and Web Application Testing. Working knowledge of product / defect management systems ,  preferably Jira. Expertise in testing mobile applications for functionality ,  stability and performance ,  preferably in the Android or IOS area. Experience in Requirements Analysis and writing detailed Requirement Specifications documents. Worked as a Business Analyst in Healthcare or other domains. Perform stability test setup such as Android Monkey testing ,  analyze crash logs and file appropriate bug reports to engineering. Helping to improve processes and procedures. Raising descriptive ,  concise and useful bug reports. Producing clear and concise test reports. Quickly acquiring new testing and technical skills and working with new technologies with little support. Automating functional and regression tests using well - structured maintainable code. Actively supporting agile development methods and best practices. Supporting and actively work towards test driven development. Experience reading user stories and testing of software products (no coding or automation required). Basic understanding of coding and ability to write simple code ,  queries and tools. Experience working with Xcode ,  Eclipse and Android SDK or other mobile app SDKs and IDEs.    Senior candidates in this area should have the ability to work as SCRUM MASTERS.    Compensation: Best in the Industry. Stock options will be provided in addition to CTC.   Great! Please fill out the form above and we ll get back to you as soon as we can. We look forward to hearing from you!

column2: As an Associate Test Engineer, you will play a vital role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products through meticulous testing practices. You will work closely with the testing team, developers and other stakeholders to design, execute and report test cases. Your expertise in both Automation and Manual Testing will contribute to the improvement of our testing processes, enabling us to deliver exceptional software solutions to our clients.     ?   Key Responsibilities:      Design, develop and maintain automated test scripts using industry-standard automation tools for regression, integration and performance testing.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers and business analysts to understand project requirements, create comprehensive test plans and test cases.     Execute manual and automated test cases to validate the functionality, usability and performance of software applications.     Identify and document defects with clear and reproducible steps, track issues and verify bug fixes.     Work closely with developers to reproduce and troubleshoot issues, ensuring timely resolution and retesting of defects.     Perform various types of testing, including functional, non-functional, integration and end-to-end testing, as per the project requirements.     Continuously improve and optimize the testing process to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the QA team.     Requirements Skills:      Proven 3 to 5 years of experience in software testing, including both manual and automation testing.     Strong understanding of software testing concepts, methodologies and best practices.     Hands-on experience with test automation tools like Selenium, Appium, JUnit, or similar.     Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Python or JavaScript for test automation.     Solid knowledge of manual testing techniques and the ability to write clear and concise test cases.     Familiarity with defect tracking systems and test management tools.     Experience testing network applications and APIs.     Familiarity with version control systems and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.     Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate effectively.     Actively contribute to a positive and collaborative work culture, sharing knowledge and assisting team members.     Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.

You will directly own the results from the verification and validation testing cycle and ensure the high expectations of our customers are met. You must have experience in project execution from start to completion contributing to complex aspects of the project. You should be able to resolve issues in creative ways while exercising judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions.    Responsibilities: 1. Creating and writing guidelines for testing new products 2. Writing programs and scripts as necessary to test Compiler using command line 3. Executing tests using diagnostic software,  simulators and hardware 4. Be a proponent of automation to enhance test automation capability through scripting and other software tools 5. Find,  isolate and document issues with tools 6. Collaborating cross- functionally to drive quality and communicating results 7. Be a vocal proponent and owner for quality in the compiler development process 8. Work with compiler development engineers to understand overall technical architecture and how each feature is best validated   Minimum Qualification: 1. BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science 2. 4+ years of Compiler testing and QA experience 3. Hands on Experience with Compilers and Command Line Testing  4. Hands on working experience in scripting languages such as Bash,  Arc,  Shell,  Said 5. Familiarity with compiler optimizations,  code generation and overall design of compilers 6. Experience with program analysis,  synthesis and verification,  constraint satisfaction,  and pipeline optimizations 7. Working Experience in developing test guidelines from specifications and requirements 8. Hands on knowledge and experience in working on Linux environment 9. Knowledge on Low level assembly in any one of the architecture -  x86,  ARM,  RISC etc is desired 10. Experience with communication across multiple teams 11. Ability to debug and problem solve in unfamiliar code bases and environments 12. Knowledge of the Quality Assurance process 13. Knowledge on Configuration Management,  preferably Clearcase 14.

column2: Job   Title:   Tester   (Manual   +   Automated   with   API   Testing)   Location:   Bangalore Job   Description: We are seeking a skilled Tester to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for ensuring the quality of software products through meticulous manual testing as well as the ability to develop and implement automated test scripts. Additionally, experience with API testing using tools like SoapUI will be highly valued. column2: Avya Technology Pvt. Ltd. is currently seeking a skilled and ambitious Senior QA Engineer to join our Quality Assurance team. We are looking for an individual with a proven track record of at least 5-6 years in software quality assurance, demonstrating proficiency in QA methodologies, test planning, and execution. If you possess strong analytical skills, a passion for quality, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply.  Responsibilities : Quality Assurance: Participate in the end-to-end quality assurance process, including functional, regression, and performance testing for software projects.  Test Planning and Execution: Assist in creating and executing test plans, test cases, and test scripts according to project requirements.  Automation Support: Collaborate with the team to support and contribute to automation initiatives aimed at enhancing testing efficiency and coverage. Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of test plans, test cases, and test results. Team Support: Support the QA team by sharing knowledge, providing assistance, and contributing to the continuous improvement of QA processes. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including developers and product managers to ensure the delivery of high-quality software.   Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5-6 years of experience in software quality assurance. Proficiency in QA methodologies, test planning, and test execution. Basic understanding of test automation tools and frameworks is desirable. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Good communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.) column2: As part of the QA team, a new role has been created to support our growing product suite.      You will ensure a high standard of product functionality with every release by identifying bugs and design gaps as well as documenting problems encountered at a sufficient level of detail for development teams to resolve quickly.      Clear communication in articulating complex problems in plain English and proposing timely solutions to Product and Engineer stakeholders is critical.      The QA Engineer must be familiar with Software Quality Assurance methodologies and show ownership from start to completion. It will be expected you will spend a portion of your time working with the internal development team, and possibly UAT teams depending on the nature of the solution being tested.      The team is comprised of highly experienced developers (front end, back end and full stack), technical architects, and other QA teams. A proactive working style with focus on delivering results and the ability to balance competing priorities will be essential to success.      Main responsibilities will include:        Work with a teams to test end-to-end solution.      Establish QA procedures, maintain consistency and continuous improvement of ways of working.      Review and suggest proposed acceptance criteria and test cases during early stages of process and provide details of trade-offs to decision makers collaboratively.      Create and executes testing scenarios/test cases and user acceptance criteria providing clear technical &, where relevant, business information on any issues identified.      Work with, and support internal teams, product management, UX, and technical resources on acceptance criteria, issue logging and tracking, and ongoing testing and release management.      Actively participate in daily, weekly & sprint-related team meetings and brainstorming activities related to project issues, collaborate with development, architecture & product management      Analyze discrepancies in service or performance and make recommendations for product or service updates.      Story priming in Jira to cover scenarios to align business requirements      Test reports with initial triaging.      Create Seed data and test data for different scenarios.      Look into test automation to improve efficient around QA tasks overtime.        Key requirements        Solid experience testing Data centric applications      Experience with understaning test strategy, write and execute test cases for feature testing, regression testing, sanity, smoke and end to end system testing      Proficient in debugging and troubleshooting including use of Data tools and developer tools for data collection and issue reporting      Experience with test automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Cucumber/Gherkin) will be a plus      Experience with Cloud Platform tools and services (GCP/Bigquery) will be a plus      High attention to detail and solid analytical skills is a must      Highly motivated and self-starter approach to job. Able to work independently as part of a globally distributed team, proactively requesting assistance, advice and input as needed      To maximize working time with different teams around the world      Adaptable and change-resilient, working well in a dynamic fast-paced global environment, accepting new ideas and initiatives and making positive use of opportunities presented.      Demonstrated capacity to plan, prioritize and organize time, project schedules and multiple project activities      A degree of creativity in developing and executing tests is required      Solid knowledge of IT Methodologies and Software Development Lifecycle for information systems development, testing principles, project methodologies and practice      Mastering iterative agile development methodologies      Working knowledge of SQL              At least 5 to 7 years of experience in a similar position

Consults with development engineers in resolution of problems and suggest functional solutions.      Excellent leadership skills, strong and innovative approach to problem solving and finding solutions.      Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written and Client Interaction skills.      This can include preparing documents that outline testing processes, generating use cases to ensure that testing captures the software or system s functional requirements, and enacting test plans for new software products or updates to existing systems. The QA team lead also introduces and updates these processes in collaboration with their team and developers.      QA team leads manage the day-to-day activities of QA team members, including scheduling and managing ongoing projects. They also conduct employee training and evaluation and may provide support during the hiring and onboarding process. QA team leads need to assess current testing needs and schedules and determine staffing needs to effectively conduct the testing. They also oversee team members work to ensure that they adhere to specifications.      QA team leads play an active role in software testing, following the processes and procedures that they developed and testing new and updated systems for bugs and other issues. The QA team lead may support compatibility testing, develop and utilize software to capture performance data, and evaluate individual aspects of the software or system including user interfaces and functional requirements.          Maintain Documentation          Throughout the development and QA process, QA team leaders maintain detailed documentation related to the software or system. These documents provide developers and engineers with vital information about software performance and issues and are used in future development work. QA documentation also ensures that systems are adequately tested and that all use cases are accounted for.          Manage Testing Schedules          QA team leads develop, enact, and manage testing schedules, ensuring that the QA team meets expectations and deadlines. These schedules tend to include specific elements of the software or system and frequently need to be completed before developers and engineers can continue with the next phase of development. QA team leads need to monitor team activities to ensure that they meet schedules, specifically when multiple projects are in process at once.          Coordinate Bug Fixes with Development Teams          Finally, QA team leads coordinate bug fixes and software enhancements with development and engineering teams. In some cases, the QA team lead may resolve some of these issues on their own and conduct further testing to ensure stability and usability, but more frequently they will report software and system issues to developers or engineers and test the next iteration of the software to ensure that those bugs have been eliminated.          Minimum Requirements         7+ years Lead Quality Assurance and/or systems testing experience is required. Experience in working with Test Management and Defect Management Tools.      Benefits: In return for your expertise, we offer growth, opportunity, and a competitive compensation and benefits package in a casual work environment.          Key Skills         Technical Test Lead, Performance testing, Effort estimation, Project execution, Issue resolution, Test execution. Test cases Management. Test planning Automation testing, Selenium, API Testing, Manual Functional Testing, Bug life cycle, SQL, JavaScript, Python, Ruby Scripting Mobile Testing.      Establish and evolve formal QA processes, ensuring that the team is using industry-accepted best practices.      Oversee all aspects of quality assurance including establishing metrics, applying industry best practices, and developing new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met.      Act as key point of contact for all QA aspects of releases, providing QA services and coordinating QA resources internally and externally.      Lead and mentor QA team members, as well as manage outside contract testers.      Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures (manual and automated).
