column2: Role Purpose:           The role of a QA Engineer involves defining and driving innovative automated testing strategies and toolsets into the overall development process, performing Quality Assurance and Test activities, analyzing the results and submitting observations to the development team. This involves developing and executing tests across the Platform to ensure application performance, scalability, functional consistency and security.          The ideal candidate would be an effective communicator who is comfortable discussing issues / ideas within the business and with clients. The right candidate would also be an enthusiastic tester whose drive is towards continuous improvement and a focus on helping the team deliver quality product.           Key Accountabilities:           Create test designs, test processes, test cases and test data.            Ensure scalability: Test the architecture effectively to ensure scalability without compromising on performance by using smart test data samples to test the framework of the application at important moments.             Ascertain functional consistency: Define variability accurately through effective functional testing to remove uncertainty.             Security Testing: Proper testing needs to be done to ensure that confidential data, processed on a big data platform, should be kept secure. Security of large volumes of data used should be ensured while developing the application.             Failover Testing: Validate recovery method and check that data processing happens seamlessly when switched from name node to other data nodes.             Become involved in the creation of business requirements, inputting test scripts and test scenarios to ensure developers understand the business requirements, ensuring effective testing.             Design and write test automation scripts using test automation frameworks.             Execute all test cases and report defects, define severity and priority for each defect.             Ensure that all test related work is carried out as per the defined standards and procedures.             Interact with clients to better understand product requirements or design modifications.             Be meticulous about documentation and maintaining a robust log of all test cases and test results.             Proactively bring issues/problems to the attention of the team; generating, proposing and implementing innovative solutions to solve them.             Work as part of cross functional, passionate agile project teams to ensure quality is driven into the heart of the development process from requirements definition through to delivery.             Experience:             Demonstrable QA and Test experience across full SDLC.             Ability to interpret written requirements and technical specifications and derive valuable test cases.             Testing enterprise applications deployed to cloud environments such as AWS.              Understanding of coding enterprise applications within Java, Scala, Python and/or other languages.             Understanding of Hadoop and NoSQL database technologies, MySQL and Elastic Search is preferred.             Agile / Scrum experience.             Understanding of development methodologies.             Experience using GIT.             Skills:             Strong Analytical, Development and Testing skills, including a thorough understanding of how to translate requirements into design specs, coding and creating test scenarios for functional and end-to-end testing.             Paying attention to detail to look for patterns and spot irregularities.             Learning new skills willingly in the ever-changing world of technology.             Understanding the lifecycle of a project from conception through to result.             Ability to collaborate positively with team members based locally and remotely.             Excellent client facing skills.             Excellent communication and problem-solving skills             Knowledge:             Thorough understanding of SDLC, specifically automated QA processes in agile development environments.             Significant experience in Test automation and Dev Ops tooling             Practical knowledge of Big Data technologies Spark and Hadoop is preferred.             Technology know-how on the relevant technology stack used.           Proficient with bug tracking and test management toolsets to support development processes.

column2: A manual tester is responsible for testing software applications manually, without the use of automation tools.          Their job duties include:         Understanding software requirements and specifications.     Creating and executing test cases, plans and scripts.     Identifying and documenting defects and issues found during testing.     Working with development teams to resolve defects and ensure software quality.     Participating in review and inspection of requirements, design and code.     Staying updated with new testing methods and technologies.     Communicating testing progress, status and issues to project stakeholders. column2: Diverse Lynx  is looking for CAN or Diagnostic testing  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    you will be responsible for testing and validating electronic control systems, particularly those utilizing Controller Area Network (CAN) communication protocols     This role involves designing and executing diagnostic tests, identifying and troubleshooting issues, and ensuring the reliability and functionality of automotive or embedded systems     The CAN or Diagnostic Testing Engineer plays a critical role in ensuring the quality and performance of electronic control units       Key Responsibilities:       Test Planning and Design:Collaborate with development teams to understand system requirements and design comprehensive testing plans     Develop test cases and scenarios for functional and diagnostic testing     CAN Communication Testing:Validate and test electronic control units (ECUs) that utilize CAN communication protocols     Ensure proper functionality of CAN bus communication within the system     Diagnostic Testing:Design and execute diagnostic tests to validate fault detection and reporting mechanisms     Identify, analyze, and resolve issues related to diagnostic functionality     Automation and Scripting:Implement test automation scripts to streamline repetitive testing processes     Utilize scripting languages (eg, Python) for test automation     Test Execution and Reporting:Execute test cases and document test results thoroughly     Provide clear and detailed reports on testing outcomes, including identified issues and resolutions     Collaboration with Development Teams:Work closely with software and hardware development teams to understand system architecture and design     Collaborate on debugging and resolving issues found during testing     Quality Assurance:Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies     Implement best practices for ensuring the quality and reliability of electronic control systems     Documentation:Maintain detailed documentation of test plans, test cases, and testing procedures     Create and update documentation for diagnostic and CAN communication protocols

column2: The successful candidate would be expected to be a part of the Retail Technology Performance testing team. The manager will be responsible for leading the functional and system integration testing on the projects/release. The test managerrsquos key responsibilities would include defining appropriate test strategies and approaches for the project deliverables, developing a firm understanding of the systems and high level requirements, formulating test estimations and plans, and reporting progress. The test manager would require understanding various aspects automation, and being able to guide and help his team in achieving the desired level of automation in the projects. The test manager would be expected to interact with a wide variety of stakeholders, including programme managers, development managers, architects, delivery leads, business analysts, test managers and functional automation leads, so clear communication skills are very important. Experience and understanding of agile delivery methodology, would be an added advantage for this role. column2: A manual tester is responsible for testing software applications manually, without the use of automation tools.          Their job duties include:         Understanding software requirements and specifications.     Creating and executing test cases, plans and scripts.     Identifying and documenting defects and issues found during testing.     Working with development teams to resolve defects and ensure software quality.     Participating in review and inspection of requirements, design and code.     Staying updated with new testing methods and technologies.     Communicating testing progress, status and issues to project stakeholders.The manual tester should have a good understanding of software development and testing methodologies, and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Good communication and interpersonal skills are also essential.

column2: We are looking for an innovative and experienced Quality Analyst to join our team. The Quality Analyst is responsible for developing and supporting the planning, design, and execution of test plans, test scripts, and process plans for projects. The successful candidate will work closely with various departments to perform and validate test cases based on quality requirements, and recommend changes to predetermined quality guidelines. You will be responsible for ensuring that the end product meets the minimum quality standards, is fully functional and      user-friendly.       Responsibilities:         Coordinates user acceptance testing (UAT) with the lines of business- Create test scenarios/cases based on the business requirements         Execute test cases and analyze results         Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved         Ensures the full application of all relevant quality assurance protocols, processes and procedures         Acts as a manual tester to handle all manual testing duties         Documents, tracks and verifies defects and fixes in assigned applications         Assists in the development and streamlining of quality assurance models, providing input based on relevant empirical information         Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies         Work with a business analyst/project Manager to get test scenarios/cases reviewed and approved.         Assists in the defining new tools for use in quality assessment         Communicates clearly and effectively with customers, other departments, customer service associates, management, and peers         Participates in ensuring that assigned projects adhere to agreed-upon functional specifications and applicable quality assurance standards         Manages the troubleshooting and resolution of quality assurance problems and issues         Works on the interpretation of quality assurance issues and problems for technical and non-technical personnel       Why we think this job is great:       It s a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you ll work from home with tech provided by the company         You ll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver.       Qualifications:       2-3 years of experience in manual testing experience in web-based and standalone applications         Experience developing, documenting and implementing quality assurance standards         Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools         Strong experience with cross browser and cross platform testing (PC, mobile and tablet)         Strong experience in email and ad unit testing         Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills         Experience writing new test cases based on requirements         Demonstrated positive, results oriented attitude         Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal         Ability to work independently and efficiently

column2: ETL Quality Analyst - Healthcare          Nature of Job    Remote        Position Summary        The Quality Assurance Analyst will develop test plans, test cases and test scripts for projects, among other assigned duties. The Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for supporting the planning, design and execution of system testing on simple to complex implementations. The QA Analyst works collaboratively within the IT department and business units to execute and validate test cases based upon system requirements.        Responsibilities          Develop test plans, test cases, test scripts and test reports on multiple projects of varying size.      Perform testing on various software, integrations, and reporting systems.      Validate that user expectations are achieved during the testing process.      Review user requirements documents to ensure that requirements are testable      Identify and remedy defects within the production process.      Recommend, implement, and monitor preventative and corrective actions to ensure that quality assurance standards are achieved.      Investigate customer complaints and product issues.      Ensure ongoing compliance with quality and industry regulatory requirements.      Accountable for clear understanding of mission and goals for entire team. Provides clear direction to achieve goals, creating an environment that fosters team commitment and employee engagement. Establishes practices, policies and operating procedures and ensures alignment to departmental objectives and strategy.      Understands effective communication across all levels of the organization (both upward and downward) with the appropriate message, the right tone and the appropriate level of impact.      Teammate is able to make the complex seem less complex, is a consensus builder and brings people and teams together. Is able to calm tense situations by bringing clarity and organization to the forefront. Ensures each level of the organization has the information needed and the context needed to produce favorable results. Builds strong relationship with IT operational leaders to ensure connectivity to the business.      Creates a work environment in which people are able to perform to the best of their abilities. Recognizes talent and maximizes potential in others. Holds self and team accountable for technical abilities, productive results and leadership attributes of the organization.      Recognizes problems and is able to make recommendations/decisions on the best course of action to remediate. Resourceful at coming up with solutions using existing or available resources based on knowledge of the organization and level of execution effort.      Establishes measurement criteria and systems to track daily processes, implementation of new initiatives and value creation.      Translates initiatives into actions through a thoughtful, organized and well-planned approach.          Specific Job Skills and Experience          3 years of Quality Assurance Analyst experience.      2 years working knowledge in a Data Warehouse/BI environment, ETL tool skills a strong plus.      2 years working knowledge of healthcare medical group business areas (clinical, operations, care management).      Strong SQL skills and full understanding of querying relational databases.      Experience with data quality and profiling tools.      Experience translating detailed requirements, design documents, and workflows in support of QA activities      Experience with contemporary Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies such as Agile.      Ability to work with data warehouse and BI developers in formulating recommendations and tactics based on QA findings      Demonstrated excellent organizational, analytical, writing, problem solving and interpersonal skills.          Education        Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Management or similar required.        Our Benefits:        Our team culture is very open, highly collaborative and fun! We support our employees at work (and play) and provide fantastic perks: opportunity for rapid growth, paid courses and training, career counseling and mentorship, exposure to state of the art technology solutions, Time off to relax and recharge, flexible working hours, Work from Home, Paid days off to spend time with your loved ones, Office parties with plenty of food and beverages, ergonomic workstations and much more.

column2: Solution Delivery Test Engineer Description - HP is the worlds leading personal systems and printing company, we create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. Our innovation springs from a team of individuals, each collaborating and contributing their own perspectives, knowledge, and experience to advance the way the world works and lives. We are looking for visionaries, like you, who are ready to make a purposeful impact on the way the world works. At HP, the future is yours to create! Job Summary This role is responsible for leading functional project teams to oversee the entire testing process. The role ensures adherence to testing guidelines and standards, and analyzes test data to provide actionable insights. The role applies advanced subject matter knowledge to improve product quality, mitigate risks, and drive innovation. Responsibilities Leads and provides expertise to functional project teams of other test engineers and internal and outsourced test partners responsible for all stages of systems, equipment, and device testing, including solution and test plan design, validation, tooling, test execution and results evaluation. Expands relationships with internal and outsourced partners for systems, equipment, and device testing. Reviews and evaluates product designs and project activities for compliance with technology and testing guidelines and standards. Analyzes and interprets test and compliance data and prepares technical reports for use by other engineering, and management personnel. Resolves test yield problems by performing analysis of root causes, developing, and coordinating corrective action measures. Provides tangible feedback based on results to improve product quality and mitigate risk of product failure. Provides domain-specific expertise and overall test engineering leadership and perspective to cross- organization projects, programs, and activities. Applies advanced subject matter knowledge, and contributes to other complex projects, and exercises independent judgment in resolving business issues and establishing policies. Drives innovation and integration of new technologies into projects and activities in the test engineering organization. Provides guidance and mentoring to less- experienced staff members to set an example of test engineering design and development innovation and excellence. Education & Experience  Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 7-10 years of work experience, preferably in debug and validation, or a related field. Preferred Certifications NA Knowledge & Skills Agile Methodology Automation Computer Science Debugging Electrical Engineering Java (Programming Language) Jenkins JIRA New Product Development Python (Programming Language) Scripting Scrum (Software Development) Selenium (Software) Software Development Software Testing SQL (Programming Language) Test Automation Test Engineering Test Equipment Test Planning Cross-Org Skills Effective Communication Results Orientation Learning Agility Digital Fluency Customer Centricity Impact & Scope Impacts function and leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Complexity Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Disclaimer This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management. Sustainable impact is HPs commitment to create positive, lasting change for the planet, its people, and our communities. column2: Role:  Verification Engineer  Experience:  7-8 years No. of requirements:  3 Location:  Bangalore ( Only WFO ) Key Skills Experience in manual Testing(writing test case) + ISO26262 or Functional safety Sample skills to consider in profiles for Verification Engineer Good Understanding with Functional Safety Requirement (ISO_26262) at Test Bench Level Good understanding ASPICE Process(Automotive Software Process Improvement Capability Determination) Good knowledge in Fault injection Testing Test cases traceability, performed defect tracking Evaluate test results, prepare test reports / documentation and raising defects To interact with function specialist to understand specification and design the test pattern. Validation of the electrical faults on sensors, actuators, and functional test for functionalities like Start and Stop, Cruise Control, Diesel Particulate filter Execute the in vehicle related tests cases(Using the tool OBD) Bench Testing which Includes log collection, analysis, reporting and validation of any bugs. Job Description Understand integration verification aspects of our SW - DRIVE OS related high-level requirements & associated architecture sections, contribute to test design for integration tests, provide inputs to test script/test app developers, create/review test plan, test metrics etc. The Integration tests may involve exercising multiple elements like Camera SW, BSP, CUDA, QNX System, Networking etc. Even if the candidate does not have direct experience on these SW elements, they should have experience dealing with complex embedded system SW to be able to understand the black/white box testing aspects of complex SW like DRIVE OS. Given a requirement, they should be able to provide verification points related to the requirements functionality, safety aspects or security aspects. Give an architecture fragment of a requirement describing the functionality, safety or security constraints of a set of interacting elements, they should be able to provide the verification points described in the architecture or the control flow or data flow diagrams. They should understand the concepts of applications, processes, kernel, user space, threads, priorities, cpu loading, memory, storage, interrupts, etc Involve in reviews of test cases to see if test cases are adhering the Safety, Security test methodologies recommended. Knowledge in Requirements Management tool (or other review tools) to participate in reviews and provide feedback on verifiability of requirements & architecture sections. Interact with Test app, test script developers and SQA to ensure software test process compliance with Automotive standards (ISO26262, ASPICE, ISO21434) Interact with Test app, test script developers, SQA PICs to ensure integration testing and traceability completeness. Config/Process tools, Scripting knowledge and Basic C knowledge (to check test app code used in integration testing).  Ability to code in Embedded C/C++ programming is an added advantage (though this is not the main role here). Knowledge in basic utils, tools used in test executions, dashboards, bugs database etc excel sheets, shell scripts, etc. Unit Testing experience is not the expertise we are looking for this profile, its about integration testing. Looking for Senior engineers with the above-mentioned skillset.

column2: BTL   India BTL India is looking for a Test Engineer with experience (4-6 years) to support Design and Development of medical devices. This role will be supporting the testing activities during the product development cycle including software development. Will play a key role in ensuring Product Quality and Safety during Design & Development cycle. ROLES   AND   RESPONSIBILITIES As part of the Medical Product testing team, should be able to plan, identify and execute testing activities in a product development to meet the quality and project goals but not limited to the following:   Plan and execute testing activities in a Product development project. Defining test methodology for ensuring the quality of embedded Firmware andSystem level. Creating/defining the necessary tools and test plans for conducting firmware testing and system verification. Developing new processes and tools to speed the testing process (e.g., automation testing) to improve SW test coverage and reduce testing cycle time Implement and drive Software Testing Life Cycle in an Agile development methodology Understand product features in detail, develop test cases and perform test execution to challenge the design   Perform traceability of test cases to requirements and ensure test completeness Drive and Perform Integration, Software, System, Functional and Regressiontesting through Manual and Automation testing   Ensure safety and quality of the product Work Closely with development team and Project team to meet the projecttimelines. Identifies opportunities for improvements, offer new ideas and take initiative to improve process.   Perform test optimization and early identification of defects. Demonstrate the ability to learn fast and understand new technologies andmedical domain. ESSENTIAL   QUALIFICATION   AND   EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATION: Engineering degree or above in Electrical/Electronics/Software engineering or equivalent TECHNICAL   COMPETENCY:   (ESSENTIALS) 4 to 6 Years of experience in Product Development Testing  Software and System   Good knowledge on Blackbox test case design technique. Knowledge on Agile methodology and experience in complete productdevelopment lifecycle. Experience and knowledgeable in interpreting design and identify test scenario Good knowledge in system integration, test design and verification strategy. BEHAVIOURAL   COMPETEN   CY:   Fire in the Belly - Passion for success and learning new technologies. Clarity  Systemic approach and doing in-depth with understanding ofdesign. Providing clarity.    Teamwork - Constructive approach and helping others. Learns organization vision statement and decision-making framework. Ableto understand how team and personal goals / objectives contribute to the organization vision. ADDITIONAL   QUALIFICATION   AND   EXPERIENCE   (DESIRABLES) Background in medical industry with working knowledge on IEC standards, and knowledge in testing medical devices. Good understanding of medical device testing and in driving quality and regulatory changes. Experience using a Requirements Management tool, such as Code Beamer or DOORs, Jira for requirements and test cases management.    Preferably experience in Test Automation on various platforms. Experience working on ARM based Micro controllers like STM32 andEmbedded Linux Sound knowledge of peripheral drivers like I2C/ SPI/ UART/ USB/ GPIOs/ BLE etc. The 2013 incepted BTL India R&D center in Bangalore is the second largest R&D center and an important arm of the 1993 founded established brand, BTL originally from the Czech Republic, a global innovator of Medical and Aesthetic Solutions. BTL India is a complete R&D center focused on medical product developments in areas of Cardiology, Physiotherapy and Aesthetics. BTL boasts 50 plus unique products in the market with its in- house marketing and sales in 55+ countries across the globe. BTL has four R&D centers and two manufacturing units in Europe while BTL India R&D center was started 8 years ago to add more products under the BTL product portfolio to support its growing market demands. The philosophy of the company is to create technologically unique products with high added value, top quality and original industrial design careers@btlnet.co.in http://www.btlnet.co.in

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION Job role:   QA Engineer - Manual Location:  Bangalore   We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality. QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.) Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, wed like to meet you. Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.   Job Responsibilities:  Ability to create test architecture  Develop test environments and test cases  Writing test plans and creating test cases for the product  Understanding of test frameworks and automation  Troubleshooting any errors and streamlining the testing procedures.  Analyse test results, detect issues and track root causes  Document technical issues and solutions  Build automated testing systems for regular checks  Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools  Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements  Develop, setup and execute tests on various products developed at Amagi   Embedded devices which do A/V processing   Cloud services which enable these embedded devices   Connected applications which enable the workflow for a broadcast station   Job Requirements:  2+ years of experience with focus in areas such as systems, network, and/or application testing  Basic knowledge of Linux environment  Well versed in Unix commands  Knowledge of AWS & GCP is an added advantage.  Ability to understand scripts in at least one language such as Bash / Python / Ruby / Node.js  Audio Video Encode/Decode knowledge is added advantage  Experience/knowledge in Test Automation using Python/Selenium is added advantage  A basic understanding of web applications, networking and databases  Issue debugging skill is a must Preferred Relevant Work Experience:  2+ Years Education/Qualifications:  BE/BTech/MTech in  a) Computer Science or  b) Electronics/Communications with computer science electives.

column2: We are seeking a diligent and detail-oriented Software Tester to join our dynamic team. As a Software Tester, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products through comprehensive testing and analysis. Your responsibilities will include developing test plans, executing test cases, identifying and documenting defects, and collaborating with the development team to ensure timely issue resolution. Your expertise and commitment to quality will contribute to the successful delivery of high-performance software solutions to our clients.         Responsibilities:       Develop test plans, test scenarios, and test cases based on project requirements and design specifications.     Execute automated tests to verify software functionality, performance, usability, and security.     Identify, document, and prioritize software defects, bugs, and issues using a defect tracking system.     Collaborate with the development team to understand software requirements, design intent, and technical specifications.     Conduct thorough regression testing to ensure that software modifications and enhancements do not adversely affect existing functionality.     Perform compatibility testing across different platforms, operating systems, and browsers.     Participate in design and requirement review meetings to provide input on testability and quality aspects.     Analyze and troubleshoot software issues, investigating and communicating their root causes to the development team.     Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and project managers, to ensure effective communication and collaboration throughout the testing process.     Continuously enhance testing processes and methodologies to improve efficiency, accuracy, and effectiveness.     Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software testing.       Requirements:       Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).     Proven experience as a Software Tester or in a similar role.     Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and software testing principles.       Strong programming skills:    Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, or JavaScript is essential for writing and maintaining test automation scripts.     Experience with automation testing tools: Familiarity with popular automation testing frameworks and tools such as Selenium WebDriver, Appium, Cucumber, JUnit, TestNG, or similar tools is necessary.     Knowledge of test automation frameworks: Understanding and experience with test automation frameworks, such as Keyword-driven, Data-driven, or Behavior-driven development (BDD), can be advantageous.     Scripting and automation experience: Ability to write and execute automation scripts for web applications, APIs, or mobile applications using appropriate tools and frameworks.     Test data management: Ability to create and maintain test data sets and databases for automated testing.     Performance testing: Familiarity with performance testing tools like JMeter or LoadRunner to conduct load, stress, and performance testing is a plus.     Agile methodologies: Experience working in an Agile development environment and understanding of Agile principles and practices.     API testing: Knowledge of API testing tools such as Postman, SoapUI, or REST Assured, and experience in testing web services, RESTful APIs, or microservices.     Test automation best practices: Understanding of best practices for test automation, including test script design, maintainability, scalability, and test data management.     Troubleshooting and debugging skills: Proficiency in identifying and resolving issues with test automation scripts and environments.     Strong problem-solving skills: Ability to analyze complex scenarios and troubleshoot issues encountered during test automation.     Self-motivated and proactive: Willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and frameworks independently and stay updated with industry trends in test automation.
column11: ERP, Testing tools, Debugging, Javascript, Performance testing, Selenium, Troubleshooting, SDLC, CRM, Python

column2: A manual tester is responsible for testing software applications manually, without the use of automation tools.          Their job duties include:         Understanding software requirements and specifications.     Creating and executing test cases, plans and scripts.     Identifying and documenting defects and issues found during testing.     Working with development teams to resolve defects and ensure software quality.     Participating in review and inspection of requirements, design and code.     Staying updated with new testing methods and technologies.     Communicating testing progress, status and issues to project stakeholders.The manual tester should have a good understanding of software development and testing methodologies, and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Good communication and interpersonal skills are also essential.

column2: We are hiring from all over India. However we               prefer                people from                             Ahmedabad. Enjoy work from home, flexible and remote work culture.                                               We are a digital product engineering company. Our engineers are the best there is. If you think you can ace our interviews and want a career in cutting edge product engineering with a fast paced work environment then you have found a home!                             As an Automation QA Engineer you will be responsible for both Manual and Automation QA activities. The person in this role will be responsible to recommend frameworks and best practice around QA Automation, build Automation scripts using tools like Selenium.                  Also, assist the project team with Performance and Load testing as required. To succeed in this role, the person should be well versed with both automation and manual testing of Web based applications as well as have a solid understanding of, cross browser/ cross-device testing API, DB, Functional and Regression testing.                     Responsibilities                       Participate in Agile ceremonies, help analyze requirements, develop testing strategies, and write manual and automated tests for new and existing functionality.            Design, develop, and execute manual and automated tests for Web-based applications in the required framework.           Monitor all development cycles, prepare test data, and evaluate test results Develop automation for RESTful APIs Experience working with Cloud services and CI/CD tools like Jenkins.               Act as a key point of contact for all QA aspects of releases, providing QA services, and UAT guidance.                 Requirements        5+ year of automation engineering experience with Selenium WebDriver using PHP /JAVA/C#/.net            5+ years of experience with agile software development testing, reviewing user stories, acceptance criteria, and other available information in order to develop test plans and test scenarios, both manual and automated           Ability to coordinate with developers and product owners to provide efficient feedback, and to maintain the architecture for the automation suite.           Experience with CI/CD, using Jenkins, or Docker like services. Experience in certifying APIs using dependencies like REST Assured / CURL.           Experience with testing Web Applications in Cross-browser and cross-device, using automated tools.           Exposure to/Experience with an industry-leading cloud-based application Have knowledge about Advertisement/ Financial/ Digital Marketing domain Proficiency in SQL and knowledge of other programming languages.           Nice to have skills: Experience with Visual Testing Tools Database/Data Warehouse testing Experience with testing WordPress Application               Experience with performance and/or security testing

column2: System Configuration: Oracle BRM Developers configure and customize the Oracle BRM system to meet the specific requirements of the organization     This involves defining product offerings, pricing models, billing cycles, and business rules     Customization: They may develop custom components and extensions to the Oracle BRM system to add functionality or integrate it with other systems, such as CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software or payment gateways     Data Modeling: Oracle BRM Developers design data models and schemas to represent customer subscription information, products, usage, and billing data within the Oracle BRM system     Pricing and Rating: They configure pricing models and rating engines in Oracle BRM to accurately calculate charges for products and services based on customer usage and business rules     Pipeline Configuration: Oracle BRM includes a real-time processing pipeline for rating and charging     Developers configure and fine-tune the pipeline to ensure that usage data is processed accurately and in a timely manner     Integration: They integrate Oracle BRM with other systems and applications, such as CRM, ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), and payment gateways, to ensure seamless data exchange and process flows     Custom Business Logic: Oracle BRM Developers write custom business logic using languages like C/C++, Java, or the built-in BRM scripting language to implement unique billing and revenue management rules     Billing and Invoicing: They set up billing cycles, generate invoices, and configure invoice formatting based on organizational needs

column2: We're looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) test engineer who is a self starter, can work independently with little direction and be able to juggle multiple projects with quick turnaround times. QA test engineer's responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.) Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards. Troubleshooting and debugging  You should have an excellent troubleshooting and testing skills to eliminate bugs and server-side issues with web applications. Team collaboration ??In this role, you will work closely with frontend, backend developers and other programmers, so they need strong team collaboration and coordination skills. Technical writing ??throughout the testing process, you will create and update your work related to your testing as per our standard, so you should know the best practices for documentation and technical writing.
